entries.english: Gũcambia/gũgooca (criticize/praise), Gũtaara/kũhĩtithia (guide/mislead), Gũtherema/gũkũndera (accept/reject), Gũthĩnia/gũteithia (bother/help), Gũtonga/gũthĩna (be rich/be poor), Gwaka/gũtharia (build/demolish), Kũgetha/kũhanda (harvest/plant), Kũhũnyũka/kũrura (be fast/be slow), Kũhũta/kũhũna (be hungry/be full), Kũrĩra/gũtheka (cry/laugh), Kwĩhĩka/kwĩgũucia (feel shy/be proud), Mũnyuko/noru (thin/fat), Ndũma/ũtheri (darkness/light), Ngũĩ/ndũhĩo (anger/excitement), Njamba/kĩguoya (hero/coward), Thayũ/mbaara (peace/war)

Riiko/Marĩiko (stove/cooker sing/plur), Metha (table), Mwaburi/Mĩaburi (umbrella), Thaani (plate), Gĩtĩ/Itĩ (chair), Nyũgũ (clay pot), Kahiũ/Tũhĩũ (knife), Hũma (fork), Gĩciko/Iciko (spoon), Mbakũri (serving bowl), Mũcuba/Mĩcuba (bottle), Njagĩ (water pitcher/jug), Thaburia (cooking pot), Ngirathi (glass), Kĩĩhũri/Cĩihũri (gourd/calabash), Mbũthũ (decorated calabash)

Iria (milk), Thota (soda), Ũcũrũ (porridge), Thubu (soup), Cai (tea), Kahũwa (coffee), Iria igagatu (sour milk), Maĩ (water), Maĩ ma macungwa (orange juice), Maĩ ma ndimũ (lemon juice), Maĩ ma matunda (fruit juice)

Wa/ya/rĩa/gĩa mbere (first), wa/ya/rĩa/gĩa keerĩ (second), wa/ya/rĩa/gĩa gatatũ (third), wa/ya/rĩa/gĩa kana (fourth), wa/ya/rĩa/gĩa gatano (fifth), wa/ya/rĩa/gĩa gatandatũ (sixth), wa/ya/rĩa/gĩa mũgwanja (seventh), wa/ya/rĩa/gĩa kanana (eighth), wa/ya/rĩa/gĩa kenda (ninth), wa/ya/rĩa/gĩa ikũmi (tenth)
